reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in June 2012, and, frankly, it was a mistake from start to finish. The hotel possibly has a marvellous past history, but, no longer. It's trading on its past glories, which would be fine if the fittings were all antiques, but they're not, it's become a mish-mash of styles and fittings. The room we had, 117, was very small, and with a minuscule bathroom with poorly laid-out fittings - my wife is 5' 4 1/2" and she couldn't see herself in the mirror, because the mirror had been installed by a member of the Dutch basketball team!
reviews.title: Greatly in need of a refurbishment

reviews.text: The restaurant served food popular in the 1970s - heavy sauces and fried accompaniments with everything. We didn't like it, probably, elderly Dutch folk do!
reviews.title: Nice place and very good spa area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel's business is now coach tours, day-trippers and small conferences. Fine, but, therefore, if you want to stay in the centre of Volendam, definitely don't pay anything anywhere near the rack rate - you'll be done if you do.
reviews.title: the restaurant is like a museum

reviews.text: It is located in a very nice place, just in front of the sea, in a pedestrian zone, rich of shops and restaurants. You can easily go in Amsterdam by public transport. The staff is kind and the reception and the publics area are very cosy. It also has a very nice swimming pool and three different kinds of sauna. The rooms are spacious and typical sea-style furnished. I suggest this place also because it is really close to a no traffic zone along the sea ideal for running.
reviews.title: OK, but probably nicer in summer as a tourist.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't stay at this hotel in Volendam, but we were advised to come here for dinner to its lovely restaurant. The walls are covered with painting, drafts and sketches of fishermen's life starting from 19th century and all this art is worth to be seen! Very nice to have an eat in such an interesting atmosphere. The restaurant has good service and simple, but true delicious food, not expensive. Recommend to come here for the uncommon experience.
reviews.title: Perfect Location.
A very negative experience!
reviews.text: It was a nightmare! I became ill and was traveling by myself, I called down stairs and asked for tea, coke or something that would ease the stomach pain. The gentleman said: there was no room service and besides they were having a party down in the bar area and could not come up but I could come and get something. I went down and got some hot water, even though I was in pain. The pain persisted I called because the information in the room said call if a Doctor is needed. I called they said just drink some 7up and I would be fine. I was awake to the early morning when pain subsided. As far as this hotel was concerned or not concerned, the maid; if more serious could of found me in the morning, in not so pleasant a situation but thank goodness I ended up fine. I hesitated for a long time in writing this because I am not a negative person but my husband convinced me I should, in order to make other travelers aware!

reviews.title: Nice location, beware attic rooms
reviews.text: Volendam is a great option if you want to visit Amsterdam but not stay in the city - it's about 20 minutes by bus to the centre. The Hotel Spaander has a nice location, overlooking the water, and is surrounded by as many dutch tourist shops & bars as anyone could ever want.

The check in process was pretty disappointing for us. The room we were initially put into was a joke. It was in the attic, meaning that on one side of the bed, it wasn't just impossible to stand up, I doubt it would have been possible to sit-up in bed. Also, the windows were tiny - definitely necessary to leave the lights on during the day (the spiders weren't too impressed at being disturbed when I opened the window either). The bathroom was even funnier. As the "shower" was in the eaves, it consisted of a 3ft sq tub that you sat in to shower yourself - height clearance was at most 4 ft. Given both my wife & I are 6 feet tall, I don't know how they expected us to manage in this room.
reviews.title: cosy hotel,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel for an escape and a break. Volendam is a fishing village converted to a tourist area. Getting to the hotel by car was a headache, posts are put up on the street blocking traffic on the GPS routes and it took a few requests for directions to find a circuitous route to the hotel. If going by car make sure to phone ahead and ask for directions!
reviews.title: This is for tourists, not business travelers

reviews.text: The location is right on the lake and our room windows faced the lake over the hotel parking lot. Parking was free but limited, although this wasn't a problem for us.
reviews.title: Nice place!

reviews.text: Our first assigned room had poor wireless internet connections but the front desk was very accommodating in getting us a room closer to the end of the building where the wireless transmitter was located.
reviews.title: Gorgeous!

reviews.text: The hotel is right in the middle of all the tourist shops and right by the harbour. We didn't pay extra for breakfast but it looked very good.
reviews.title: I'd almost finished my fish when the chips arrived
Loved it
reviews.text: The building itself is quite unique, very old style with twists and turns. You have to pass through the bar/ lunch room area to get to the elevator and stairs. The rooms are older (in keeping with the decor) and the furnishings and decorations older as well. The whole hotel's decor is very Dutch and cluttered with lots of amazing pictures and nicnacs.
